1.1: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus, by the will of God, to the saints here [in Ephesus] and to the believers in Christ Jesus;
1.2: grace to you and peace from God our father and Lord Jesus Christ.
1.3: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavens in Christ,
1.4: as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, we are holy and blameless before him in love,
1.5: you predestined us for adoption through Jesus Christ to him, according to the good pleasure of his will,
1.6: to the praise of the glory of his grace that graced us in the beloved,
1.7: in whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of trespasses, according to the riches of his grace,
1.8: Who has abounded in us in all wisdom and prudence
1.9: let us know the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he purposed in himself
1.10: in the economy of the fulness of times, all things are recapitulated in Christ, things in the heavens and things on the earth; in him,
1.11: in which we were drawn, predestined according to the purpose of him working all things according to the will of his will,
1.12: to the praise of his glory we who are hopeful in Christ;
1.13: ἐν  ᾧ  καὶ  ὑμεῖς  ἀκούσαντες  τὸν  λόγον  τῆς  ἀληθείας,  τὸ  εὐαγγέλιον  τῆς  σωτηρίας  ὑμῶν,  ἐν  ᾧ  καὶ  πιστεύσαντες  ἐσφραγίσθητε  τῷ  πνεύματι  τῆς  ἐπαγγελίας  τῷ  ἁγίῳ,
1.14: which is the marriage of our inheritance, in redemption of care, in praise of his glory.
1.15: For this reason, having heard your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints,
1.16: I do not cease to be thankful for you in my prayers,
1.17: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in his knowledge,
1.18: having enlightened the eyes of [our] heart to know what is the hope of his calling, what is the riches of the glory of his inheritance among the saints,
1.19: and what is the exceeding greatness of his power in us who believe against the energy of the state of his power
1.20: Who acted in Christ, raised him from the dead, and sat down at his right hand in the heavenly places
1.21: I am above all authority and power and power and dominion and every name that is named, not only in this age but also in the age to come;
1.22: and put all things under his feet, and made him head over all things in the church,
1.23: which is his body, the fullness of him who fills all in all.

2.1: And you, being dead in your trespasses and sins,
2.2: where did you walk during the age of this world, according to the ruler of the power of the air, of the spirit of the present working among the sons of the promise;
2.3: in which we all turned back at one time in the desires of our flesh, doing the wills of the flesh and of the minds, and we were children of the nature of wrath like the rest;
2.4: But God, who is rich in mercy, because of his great love with which he loved us,
2.5: and being dead in trespasses, quicken us to Christ by grace
2.6: and he preached and sat together in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus,
2.7: That the exceeding riches of his grace may be shown in the ages to those who are to come.
2.8: for by grace you are saved through faith; and this is not of yourselves, it is the gift of God;
2.9: not of works, lest he should boast of them.
2.10: for we are poetry, built in Christ Jesus on good works which God has prepared so that we may walk in them.
2.11: For you remember that you nations in the flesh, the so-called uncircumcised under the so-called circumcision in flesh made by hand,
2.12: because you were at that time without Christ, alienated from the state of Israel and strangers to the covenants of the promise, having no hope and atheists in the world.
2.13: but now in Christ Jesus you who were once far off have been born near in the blood of Christ.
2.14: For this is our peace, who made both at once and broke the middle wall of the barrier, the enemy, in his flesh,
2.15: You abolished the law of the commandments in doctrine, that He might build the two in Himself into one new man of peace,
2.16: and deliver both in one body to God through the cross, conquering the enemy in him.
2.17: and when the good news has come, peace to you who are far away and peace to those who are near;
2.18: because through him we both have access in one spirit to the father.
2.19: Therefore, do not be strangers and sojourners, but fellow citizens with the saints and householders of God,
2.20: built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, being the cornerstone of Christ Jesus,
2.21: in which every building assembled rises to the holy temple of the Lord,
2.22: in which you too are built together into a dwelling place of God in spirit.

3.1: For this reason I Paul the prisoner of Christ [Jesus] for you Gentiles
3.2: have you heard the economy of the grace of God given to me in you,
3.3: [that] by revelation the mystery was made known to me, as I briefly prescribed,
3.4: to which you can understand my wisdom in the mystery of Christ,
3.5: which in other generations was not known to the sons of men, as now it has been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in spirit,
3.6: the nations are co-heirs and assembly and partakers of the promise in Christ Jesus through the gospel,
3.7: where he became a deacon according to the gift of God's grace given to me according to the energy of his power.
3.8: I, the least of all saints, was given this grace, to the nations the unfathomable riches of Christ were proclaimed,
3.9: and the economy of the mystery of the hidden from the ages in the God who created all things has enlightened them,
3.10: that the manifold wisdom of God may now be known to the ancients and the powers in the heavens through the church,
3.11: according to the purpose of the ages which they wrought in Christ Jesus our Lord,
3.12: in which we have the paresis and introduction in conviction through his faith.
3.13: therefore I beg you not to dwell in my sorrows for you, who are your glory.
3.14: For this I bow my knees to the father,
3.15: from which every country in heaven and on earth is named,
3.16: that he may show you according to the riches of his glory, mightily, through his spirit, in the inner man,
3.17: let Christ dwell in your hearts through faith, rooted and grounded in love,
3.18: that you may prevail and understand with all the saints what is the breadth and length and height and depth,
3.19: know the excess of the knowledge of the love of Christ, that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.
3.20: But to Him who has power over all things, we do exceedingly when we ask or think according to the power that is at work in us,
3.21: To him be the glory in the church and in Christ Jesus to all generations of the ages of ages, amen.

4.1: I beseech you therefore, I the captive in the Lord, walk worthily of the calling to which you have been called,
4.2: with all humility and meekness, with longsuffering, bearing with one another in love,
4.3: studying keep the unity of the spirit in the bond of peace;
4.4: one body and one spirit, just as you were called in one hope of your calling;
4.5: one master, one faith, one baptism;
4.6: one god and father of all, who is over all and through all and in all.
4.7: But grace was given to each of us according to the measure of Christ's gift.
4.8: for he says, He ascended on high, he captured captivity, he gave buildings to the people.
4.9: And what is the fact that He ascended, but that He also descended to the lowest [parts] of the earth?
4.10: He is the one who descends and ascends above all the heavens, to pay all things.}
4.11: and he gave me apostles, and prophets, and evangelists, and pastors and teachers,
4.12: for the preparation of the saints for the work of ministry, for the building up of the body of Christ,
4.13: until we all come to the unity of the faith and the recognition of the son of God, to a perfect man, to the measure of the age of the crew of Christ,
4.14: That we may be little children, tossed and tossed about by the wind of teaching in the midst of men in craftiness towards the method of error,
4.15: But being truthful in love, let us raise all things to him, who is the head, Christ,
4.16: from where the body being assembled and reconciled through all the senses of the grant by energy in the measure of each part the increase of the body is made into the building of the self in love.
4.17: This, then, I say and testify in the Lord, lest you walk as the nations walk in the futility of their minds,
4.18: Beings killed by the intellect, alienated from the life of God, because of the ignorance that was in them, because of the corruption of their hearts,
4.19: those who were reprobates gave themselves up to impurity in the work of all impurity in abundance.
4.20: but you did not learn Christ like that,
4.21: Yes, you heard him and were taught by him, as there is truth in Jesus,
4.22: I leave you for the former turning back the old man who wears out according to the desires of deceit,
4.23: and renew the spirit of your mind,
4.24: and put on the new man created by God in righteousness and truthfulness of truth.
4.25: Therefore, putting aside falsehood, speak the truth each one with his neighbor, for we are members of one another.
4.26: Be angry and do not sin; let not the sun rise on your anger,
4.27: give no place to the devil.
4.28: he who steals does not steal, but rather labors with his [idios] hand for the good, so that he may give it to the needy.
4.29: Let not every foul word proceed out of your mouth, but let it be good for the edification of the needy, that it may show grace to those who hear.
4.30: and do not grieve the holy spirit of God, in which you were sealed on the day of redemption.
4.31: let all bitterness and anger and wrath and clamor and blasphemy depart from you, together with all malice.
4.32: Be kind to one another, compassionate, giving yourselves as God in Christ has given you.

5.1: then be imitators of God, as beloved children,
5.2: and walk in love, as Christ also loved us and gave himself up for us as an offering and sacrifice to God for a sweet fragrance.
5.3: But fornication and impurity, or covetousness, shall not be named among you, as you ought to be saints,
5.4: and lasciviousness and childishness or eutrapelia, which did not arise, but rather gratitude.
5.5: for you know this, knowing that everyone who is a fornicator or impure or greedy, who is an idolater, has no inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God.
5.6: Do not let me deceive you with empty words, for because of these the wrath of God comes upon the sons of the promise.
5.7: do not then be partakers with them;
5.8: once was darkness, but now is light in the Lord; walk as children of light
5.9: for the fruit of the light is in all goodness and righteousness and truth
5.10: testing what is pleasing to the Lord;
5.11: and do not associate with the works of the fruits of darkness, but rather also control,
5.12: for what is done in secret by them is abominable, and they say;
5.13: but everything controlled by the light is visible,
5.14: for everywhere is manifest light.  wherefore he says, Arise, O Lord, and rise from the dead, and Christ shall rest upon you.
5.15: See then exactly how you walk, not as unwise but as wise,
5.16: buying the weather, because the days are wicked.
5.17: therefore do not be ignorant, but consider what the will of the Lord is.
5.18: and do not get drunk with wine, in which there is debauchery, but be filled with spirit,
5.19: singing to yourselves psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and singing in your hearts to the Lord,
5.20: always giving thanks for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God and Father,
5.21: submitting to each other in the fear of Christ.
5.22: The women to their own men as to the lord,
5.23: because the man is the head of the woman just as Christ is the head of the church, he is the savior of the body.
5.24: but as the church submits to Christ, so do women to men in everything.
5.25: Men, love women, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her,
5.26: that you may sanctify her by the bath of water in speech,
5.27: that he might present himself gloriously to the church, that they should not have a mole or a wart or anything of that kind, but that it should be holy and unblemished.
5.28: so should men love their women as their own bodies.  he who loves his wife loves himself,
5.29: no one, since he once divided his own flesh, but nurtures and cares for it, just as Christ does the church,
5.30: that we are members of his body.
5.31: instead of this, let a man leave [his] father and [his] mother and cleave to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh.
5.32: this mystery is great, but I speak to Christ and to the church.
5.33: but you also, each one of you, love your own woman as yourself, but the woman to fear the man.

6.1: Children, obey your parents [in the Lord], for this is righteous.
6.2: honor your father and mother, who is the first commandment in a promise,
6.3: That it may be done to you and that you may live long on earth.
6.4: And fathers, do not anger your children, but bring them up in the education and admonition of the Lord.
6.5: Servants, obey your masters according to the flesh with fear and trembling in the simplicity of your heart as to Christ,
6.6: not as philanthropists but as servants of Christ doing the will of God from the soul,
6.7: working with favor, as unto the Lord and not men,
6.8: knowing that every one, if he does anything good, is clothed with it as his master, whether he is a slave or a free man.
6.9: And gentlemen, you say these things to them, ignoring the threat, knowing that both their and your master is in heaven, and there is no partiality with him.
6.10: Therefore, be strengthened in the Lord and in the domain of his power.
6.11: put on the armor of God for your strength and stand against the wiles of the devil;
6.12: for our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the principalities, against the powers, against the world rulers of this darkness, against the spiritual things of wickedness in the heavens.
6.13: therefore take up the armor of God, so that you may be able to withstand in the day of wickedness and all those who work hard.
6.14: stand therefore having your loins girded with truth, and having put on the breastplate of righteousness,
6.15: and subduing the feet in preparation for the gospel of peace,
6.16: in all taking up the door of faith, in which you are strong all the arrows of the wicked [the] burning ones are extinguished;
6.17: and receive the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the spirit, which is the word of God,
6.18: by all prayer and supplication, praying at all times in the spirit, and being watchful unto him in all things, and pray for all the saints,
6.19: and for me, that a word may be given to me in the opening of my mouth, in parsimony you may know the mystery of the gospel
6.20: For whom I speak in solution, so that I may be praised in him as you see me speaking.
6.21: But let you also know what I say, what I am doing, may Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, always make known to you,
6.22: whom I have sent to you in this, that you may know about us and that he may plead with your hearts.
6.23: Peace to the brothers and love with faith from God the Father and Lord Jesus Christ.
6.24: the grace after all of those who love our lord Jesus Christ in incorruption.
